request_pathways.name: Mail submission (PO Box 571069, Murray, UT 84157 or 500 Eldorado Blvd, Broomfield, CO 80021)

forms.document_type: Authorization for disclosure of PHI (third-party release)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Intermountain Health provides a dedicated fillable PDF form ('Patient Request for Health Information') specifically for patients requesting their own records, separate from the third-party disclosure authorization.

red_flags: Legacy 2017 form still accessible online without indication it has been superseded
UT/ID email routes to third-party vendor R1 RCM without disclosure on the form
bright_spots: Dedicated patient self-access form separate from third-party authorization
Question-based section headings make the form conversational and approachable
Email submission accepted — fully digital pathway from completion to submission
Electronic delivery explicitly offered with email, USB, CD, portal, and free-text 'other' option
48 fillable fields with Print/Clear buttons on a single concise page
Legacy form includes multilingual interpretation notices in Chinese Traditional and Spanish

findability.rationale: Level 4: Forms were easy to find with basic web searches and directly downloadable; required navigating to the parent system site but no complex path or creative strategies.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 4: Mostly digital workflow — fully fillable 48-field PDF with Print/Clear buttons, but must submit via email/fax/mail rather than an integrated online submission portal.

content_design.rationale: Level 5: Clear, concise single-page form with numbered sections, question-based headings, plain language, and logical flow — a patient could complete it without assistance.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 5: Process designed around patient self-access as a first-class use case with a dedicated form clearly distinct from third-party release, defaulting to 'Self' as recipient and acknowledging HIPAA right of access.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: No notarization, no in-person requirement, non-conditioning language; minor ambiguities in fee disclosure ('there may be charges' without amounts) and undisclosed vendor routing, but nothing that would materially impede a patient.

overall.summary: Intermountain Health provides a strong patient access experience with a dedicated self-access form, excellent document design, and multiple electronic submission channels, falling just short of an A due to minor gaps in fee transparency and submission workflow integration.
